channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Largest US Lutheran denomination installs first Black presiding bishop
item.description: Rev. Yehiel Curry succeeds Rev. Elizabeth Eaton, who served for 12 years and was the first woman to lead the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.

item.title: Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump's National Guard deployment to Portland
item.description: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Portland, Ore., which the president had ordered ...

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: Police race to save murder evidence from being turned into scrap metal
item.description: Police say the driver of the minivan — who wore a mask, glasses and a hard hat — sprayed security cameras with blue paint to hide his crime inside an ...

item.title: Security video helps lead to a masked killer who tried to hide the crime
item.description: Dr. Steven Milner, a well-respected Oregon veterinarian, was accused of stalking and disguising himself before murdering Kenny Fandrich — the husband ...

item.title: 10/4: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Netanyahu signals that Gaza peace deal could be close; A look at the booming business of Taylor Swift and her brand.

item.title: How the US got left behind in the global electric car race
item.description: Despite a recent surge in demand, the US is a laggard in EV sales compared to much of the rest of the world.

item.title: Germany's Munich Airport reopens after 2nd drone-related closure in 24 hours
item.description: The closures are the latest after mysterious drone overflights in the airspace of European Union member countries.

item.title: 'They're not just sharing needles, they're sharing blood': How HIV cases soared in Fiji
item.description: The small South Pacific nation is facing one of the world's fastest growing HIV epidemics.

item.title: Syria holds first elections since Assad, but not in all provinces
item.description: Three provinces will not be included "for security reasons", amid concerns over how representative the polls will be.

item.title: The before and after images showing glaciers vanishing before our eyes
item.description: They are melting like never seen before, changing landscapes around the world beyond recognition.

item.title: Trump authorises deployment of 300 National Guard troops to Chicago
item.description: The controversial move follows protests over ramped-up immigration enforcement and the shooting of a woman during unrest on Saturday.

item.title: Trump urges Hamas to 'move quickly' on Gaza peace plan
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday that he hopes Hamas will have returned all remaining hostages by Oct. 13.

item.title: National parks caught in the crosshairs of government shutdown
item.description: National parks across the country face conflicting demands and uncertainty as a result of the ongoing federal funding dispute.

item.title: Populist billionaire Andrej Babiš wins Czech parliamentary election
item.description: His political comeback put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and toward Hungary and Slovakia, which have taken a pro-Russian path.

item.title: Fears of massive battery fires spark local opposition to energy storage projects
Judge temporarily blocks Trump administration from deploying troops in Portland, Oregon
Trump says he’ll send National Guard to Chicago, but details remain unclear
